isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - 10 SPEED AND 15 SPEED TRANSMISSIONS EATON RT, RTO, AND RTX SERIES - REASSEMBLE - COUNTERSHAFT ASSEMBLIES

note.para: Except for the PTO gears, the left and right countershaft assemblies are identical and reassembled in the same manner.

step1.para: If previously removed, install the roll pin and key in the keyway of the countershaft ( Figure 170).

figure.caption: Figure 170. Install Roll Pin and Key in Countershaft Keyway

step1.para: Align the keyway of the gear with the key in the countershaft and press the 2nd speed gear on the countershaft, long hub of the gear to the front of the countershaft ( Figure 171).

figure.caption: Figure 171. Press 2nd Speed Gear on Countershaft

step1.para: Press the 3rd speed gear on the countershaft, long hub of gear against 2nd speed gear hub ( Figure 172).

figure.caption: Figure 172. Press 3rd Speed Gear on Countershaft

step1.para: Press the 4th speed (or overdrive) gear on the countershaft, long hub of the gear to the front of the countershaft ( Figure 173).

figure.caption: Figure 173. Press 4th Speed Gear on Countershaft

step1.para: Start the PTO gear onto the countershaft, bullet-nose side of teeth facing up and toward the rear of the shaft ( Figure 174). Align keyway of the drive gear with the key in the countershaft and press BOTH gears onto the shaft, long hub of the drive gear against the PTO gear.

figure.caption: Figure 174. Start PTO Gear onto Countershaft

note.para: The left countershaft assembly has a 47-tooth PTO gear; the right countershaft assembly has a 45-tooth PTO gear.

figure.caption: Figure 175. Mark Left Countershaft With "L"; Right With "R"

step1.para: Install the drive gear retaining snap ring in the groove on the front of the countershaft ( Figure 176).

figure.caption: Figure 176. Install Drive Gear Retaining Snap Ring

step1.para: Use a flanged-end driver to install the bearing inner race on the countershaft, shoulder of race against the shoulder of the countershaft ( Figure 177).

figure.caption: Figure 177. Install Bearing Inner Race on Countershaft

note.para: Mark the countershaft drive gear for timing purposes. On each countershaft drive gear, mark the tooth aligned with the gear keyway and stamped with an "O" for easy identification. A highly visible color of toolmaker's dye is recommended for making timing marks.
